name: Check box
htmlBanner:
Checkbox

Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

Accessibility.html:
Overview

Some users may rely on assistive technologies, such as keyboard navigations, screen readers or voice commands, to navigate and use websites or applications. Therefore, it is important to make sure that the checkbox is properly labeled, has a clear and concise description of its function, and meets minimum color contrast, so that users with visual or cognitive impairments can understand its purpose.

Color Contrast

Checkbox text smaller than 18pt or 14pt bold must have a color contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 with its background. Note: Disabled states do not need to meet a color contrast minimum. Checkbox Group Labels Checkbox Item Labels Larger font sizes must have a color contrast ratio of at least 3:1. Parts of graphics required to understand the content must have a color contrast ratio of at least 3:1. WCAG References 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum) (Level AA) 1.4.11: Non-text Contrast (Level AA)

Interaction

For users with motor impairments, such as tremors or limited mobility, it may be difficult to accurately click or select checkboxes. To address this, designers can make checkboxes’ clickable areas easier to target, and provide alternative input methods such as keyboard shortcuts. WCAG References 2.2.2: Keyboard (Level A) 2.4.3 Focus Order (Level A)

Pointer Gestures

Users can select checkboxes by clicking the checkbox or the label.

Keyboard Interactions

All interactive elements must be operable using only a keyboard. Focus order should also be logical. Note: For checkboxes with info buttonss, tabbing order should move focus through this order: checkbox > info button > next checkbox

Example Parent Checkbox Group

Indeterminate

When an Indeterminate parent checkbox is activated, the parent checkbox will be selected and all child checkboxes will also be selected.

Selected

When a selected parent checkbox is inactivated, the parent checkbox will be unselected and all child checkboxes will also be unselected.

Unselected

When an unselected parent checkbox is activated, the child checkboxes will revert to either their previous state when the parent checkbox was last activated or to their default state when the page was initially loaded.

Screen Reader

When checkboxes are implemented, the label likely will require additional context to be announced by the screen reader. Checkbox or checkbox group must inform a user of the Name (visible label OR screen reader text) , Role (checkbox), and State (checked/not checked/mixed.) The group label must only be announced when first navigating into the group. When navigating between selections in a group, the individual selections can be announced without the group label: “, checkbox, unselected”. WCAG References 1.3.1: Info and Relationships (Level A) 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value (Level A)

Ex. 1 Focus entering a 2-state group, first item is unchecked.

“, grouop, list with X items, checkbox, not checked, to check press SPACEBAR”

Ex. 2 Focus moves to second item in the list AND item is already checked.

, checkbox, checked, to clear checkmark press SPACEBAR" Note: the position on the list does not have to be announced each time. Only new information must be announced when focus moves from one selection to the next." title="", checkbox, checked, to clear checkmark press SPACEBAR" Note: the position on the list does not have to be announced each time. Spec.html:
Anatomy

Layout

Size

There is only one size, Default. *Note: Height (24px) is default size, and depending on the design, width can change depending on checkbox label text length. Border Radius Checkbox box border radius: 2px

Spacing

Horizontal spacing in label row: 8px Vertical spacing between label row and help text: 2px

Spacing

Checkboxes under page header

All content no matter what it is should start 4px from the page header. Thereafter the spacing between headers or sub headers and it's related content might vary.

Checkboxes under header

Starting a radio or checkbox directly under a header is 8px spacing. This should also apply to drop downs and buttons but not body text

Vertical spacing between checkboxes without descriptions

Spacing between checkboxes should be 8px

Vertical spacing between checkboxes with descriptions

Spacing between checkboxes should be 8px.

Nested checkboxes spacing

Left margins for nested checkboxes should be 24px. Child checkbox should be left aligned with parent checkbox label. Follow vertical guidelines above for spacing between checkboxes. Note: Same spacing guidance follows when checkboxes are used in combination with radio buttons.

Tokens

Color and type tokens listed for component elements for each type and states. Color tokens can be found in the “Theme Tokens - Common” library. Type tokens can be found in the “Tokens - Type Application” Library.

Elements

Unselected States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA

Color token Library

Selected States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA

Color token Library

Indeterminate States

*Focus ring: #64B4FA

Color token Library

Guideline.html:
Overview

Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

Types

DON’T vertically center wrap text with the checkbox

Overview.html:
Overview

Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

What’s new

Momentum Rebrand

New more detailed documentation New color token that is more accurate and fluid Upgraded accessibility for wider audience

Resources

Momentum Design system is created using Figma. You can access the Figma file for more details of the components.

Library Access

To access the Checkbox component in the Assets Library, scroll to the section named “Checkbox” and you’ll find the component in the nested dropdown labeled “🟢 Checkbox / Component”.

Checkbox with Label - Default

Notes and Tips:

Use the following settings above to trigger this variant. Includes the following states: Rest, Hover, Pressed, Focused, and Disabled.

Properties

Type

Use the dropdown to select the checkbox type. Checkboxes can be unselected, selected, or indeterminate. Use an indeterminate for parent checkboxes for easy selection or deselection of all items

State

Use the dropdown to select checkbox state. Checkboxes have normal, hover, pressed, focused, and disabled states.

Label

Use Label toggle to turn on or off label text. Label describes the information you want to select or unselect.

Info Button

Use info button toggle to turn on or off info button. Info button is used to indicate there are additional info that will help users understand what and why such information is required.

Helper Text

Use Helper Text toggle to turn on or off Helper Text. Helper text is used to indicate additional info that will help users understand what action(s) will take place when the checkbox is selected.

How to Use Checkbox Label with Help Text

Follow these simple steps to use recommended resizing properties.

Step 1 - Checkbox Frame Resizing

Input width value or drag right edge of frame to resize to desired width. Resizing height is not necessary as settings for vertical resizing should be set to Hug.

Step 2 - Properties Panel

Turn on Help Text toggle in the properties panel.

Step 3 - Container Resizing

Select “Elements” container and change horizontal resizing from Hug to Fill. Leave vertical resizing at hug for all frames.

Step 4 - Container Resizing

Select “.BASE - Checkbox” container and change horizontal resizing from Hug to Fill. Leave vertical resizing at hug for all frames.
